page.title: 07SOCIAL SURVEY (1)
page.content: A one in ten sample survey was taken by a group of 8/9 year olds,in three different one square kilometre areas,representing a cross section of the population of Rastrick. Three types of housing were found: (1)Council estates, (2)Older private properties, and (3)Modern detached or semi-detached houses and bungalows. About 85% of all those interviewed were owner-occupiers. The majority of those sampled lived in houses or bungalows, rather than in flats or lodgings. About a quarter of the sample were old age, or retirement, pensioners. EMPLOYMENT. This sample showed that there were about 8% unemployed in the area, lower than the average of 14% currently unemployed in Calderdale as a whole.
